trans-unit.source: Use SSH keys with Hadoop on Linux-based clusters from Windows | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use SSH keys with Hadoop on Linux-based clusters from Windows | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create and use SSH keys to authenticate to Linux-based HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create and use SSH keys to authenticate to Linux-based HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Connect clusters from Windows-based clients by using the PuTTY SSH client.
trans-unit.target: Connect clusters from Windows-based clients by using the PuTTY SSH client.

trans-unit.source: Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows
trans-unit.target: Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: [Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md)
trans-unit.target: [Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md)

trans-unit.source: [Linux, Unix, OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)
trans-unit.target: [Linux, Unix, OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)

trans-unit.source: [Secure Shell (SSH)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secure_Shell) allows you to remotely perform operations on your Liux-based HDInsight clusters using a command-line interface.
trans-unit.target: [Secure Shell (SSH)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secure_Shell) allows you to remotely perform operations on your Liux-based HDInsight clusters using a command-line interface.

trans-unit.source: This document provides information on connecting to HDInsight from Windows-based clients by using the PuTTY SSH client.
trans-unit.target: This document provides information on connecting to HDInsight from Windows-based clients by using the PuTTY SSH client.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this article assume you are using a Windows-based client.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this article assume you are using a Windows-based client.

trans-unit.source: If you are using a Linux, Unix, or OS X client, see [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md).
trans-unit.target: If you are using a Linux, Unix, or OS X client, see [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: **PuTTY** and **PuTTYGen** for Windows-based clients.
trans-unit.target: **PuTTY** and **PuTTYGen** for Windows-based clients.

trans-unit.source: These utilities are available from [http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html).
trans-unit.target: These utilities are available from [http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html).

trans-unit.source: A modern web browser that supports HTML5.
trans-unit.target: A modern web browser that supports HTML5.

trans-unit.source: OR
trans-unit.target: OR

trans-unit.source: [Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows](../xplat-cli-install.md).
trans-unit.target: [Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows](../xplat-cli-install.md).

trans-unit.source: What is SSH?
trans-unit.target: What is SSH?

trans-unit.source: SSH is a utility for logging in to, and remotely executing, commands on a remote server.
trans-unit.target: SSH is a utility for logging in to, and remotely executing, commands on a remote server.

trans-unit.source: With Linux-based HDInsight, SSH establishes an encrypted connection to the cluster head node and provides a command line that you use to type in commands.
trans-unit.target: With Linux-based HDInsight, SSH establishes an encrypted connection to the cluster head node and provides a command line that you use to type in commands.

trans-unit.source: Commands are then executed directly on the server.
trans-unit.target: Commands are then executed directly on the server.

trans-unit.source: SSH user name
trans-unit.target: SSH user name

trans-unit.source: An SSH user name is the name you use to authenticate to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: An SSH user name is the name you use to authenticate to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: When you specify an SSH user name during cluster creation, this user is created on all nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: When you specify an SSH user name during cluster creation, this user is created on all nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Once the cluster is created, you can use this user name to connect to the HDInsight cluster head nodes.
trans-unit.target: Once the cluster is created, you can use this user name to connect to the HDInsight cluster head nodes.

trans-unit.source: From the head nodes, you can then connect to the individual worker nodes.
trans-unit.target: From the head nodes, you can then connect to the individual worker nodes.

trans-unit.source: SSH password or Public key
trans-unit.target: SSH password or Public key

trans-unit.source: An SSH user can use either a password or public key for authentication.
trans-unit.target: An SSH user can use either a password or public key for authentication.

trans-unit.source: A password is just a string of text you make up, while a public key is part of a cryptographic key pair generated to uniquely identify you.
trans-unit.target: A password is just a string of text you make up, while a public key is part of a cryptographic key pair generated to uniquely identify you.

trans-unit.source: A key is more secure than a password, however it requires additional steps to generate the key and you must maintain the files containing the key in a secure location.
trans-unit.target: A key is more secure than a password, however it requires additional steps to generate the key and you must maintain the files containing the key in a secure location.

trans-unit.source: If anyone gains access to the key files, they gain access to your account.
trans-unit.target: If anyone gains access to the key files, they gain access to your account.

trans-unit.source: Or if you lose the key files, you will not be able to login to your account.
trans-unit.target: Or if you lose the key files, you will not be able to login to your account.

trans-unit.source: A key pair consists of a public key (which is sent to the HDInsight server,) and a private key (which is kept on your client machine.) When you connect to the HDInsight server using SSH, the SSH client will use the private key on your machine to authenticate with the server.
trans-unit.target: A key pair consists of a public key (which is sent to the HDInsight server,) and a private key (which is kept on your client machine.) When you connect to the HDInsight server using SSH, the SSH client will use the private key on your machine to authenticate with the server.

trans-unit.source: Create an SSH key
trans-unit.target: Create an SSH key

trans-unit.source: Use the following information if you plan on using SSH keys with your cluster.
trans-unit.target: Use the following information if you plan on using SSH keys with your cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you plan on using a password, you can skip this section.
trans-unit.target: If you plan on using a password, you can skip this section.

trans-unit.source: Open PuTTYGen.
trans-unit.target: Open PuTTYGen.

trans-unit.source: For **Type of key to generate**, select **SSH-2 RSA**, and then click **Generate**.
trans-unit.target: For **Type of key to generate**, select **SSH-2 RSA**, and then click **Generate**.

trans-unit.source: ![PuTTYGen interface](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/puttygen.png)
trans-unit.target: ![PuTTYGen interface](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/puttygen.png)

trans-unit.source: Move the mouse around in the area below the progress bar, until the bar fills.
trans-unit.target: Move the mouse around in the area below the progress bar, until the bar fills.

trans-unit.source: Moving the mouse generates random data that is used to generate the key.
trans-unit.target: Moving the mouse generates random data that is used to generate the key.

trans-unit.source: ![moving the mouse around](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/movingmouse.png)
trans-unit.target: ![moving the mouse around](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/movingmouse.png)

trans-unit.source: Once the key has been generated, the public key will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: Once the key has been generated, the public key will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: For added security, you can enter a passphrase in the **Key passphrase** field, and then type the same value in the **Confirm passphrase** field.
trans-unit.target: For added security, you can enter a passphrase in the **Key passphrase** field, and then type the same value in the **Confirm passphrase** field.

trans-unit.source: ![passphrase](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/key.png)
trans-unit.target: ![passphrase](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/key.png)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] We strongly recommend that you use a secure passphrase for the key.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] We strongly recommend that you use a secure passphrase for the key.

trans-unit.source: However, if you forget the passphrase, there is no way to recover it.
trans-unit.target: However, if you forget the passphrase, there is no way to recover it.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save private key** to save the key to a **.ppk** file.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save private key** to save the key to a **.ppk** file.

trans-unit.source: This key will be used to authenticate to your Linux-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This key will be used to authenticate to your Linux-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You should store this key in a secure location, as it can be used to access your Linux-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You should store this key in a secure location, as it can be used to access your Linux-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save public key** to save the key as a **.txt** file.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save public key** to save the key as a **.txt** file.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to reuse the public key in the future when you create additional Linux-based HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to reuse the public key in the future when you create additional Linux-based HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The public key is also displayed at the top of PuTTYGen.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The public key is also displayed at the top of PuTTYGen.

trans-unit.source: You can right-click this field, copy the value, and then paste it into a form when creating a cluster using the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can right-click this field, copy the value, and then paste it into a form when creating a cluster using the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Create a Linux-based HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Create a Linux-based HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: When creating a Linux-based HDInsight cluster, you must provide the public key created previously.
trans-unit.target: When creating a Linux-based HDInsight cluster, you must provide the public key created previously.

trans-unit.source: From Windows-based clients, there are two ways to create a Linux-based HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: From Windows-based clients, there are two ways to create a Linux-based HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: **Azure Portal** - Uses a web-based portal to create the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Portal** - Uses a web-based portal to create the cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows** - Uses command-line commands to create the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows** - Uses command-line commands to create the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Each of these methods will require the public key.
trans-unit.target: Each of these methods will require the public key.

trans-unit.source: For complete information on creating a Linux-based HDInsight cluster, see [Provision Linux-based HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters.md).
trans-unit.target: For complete information on creating a Linux-based HDInsight cluster, see [Provision Linux-based HDInsight clusters](hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters.md).

trans-unit.source: Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: When using the [Azure Portal][preview-portal] to create a Linux-based HDInsight cluster, you must enter an **SSH Username**, and select to enter a **PASSWORD** or **SSH PUBLIC KEY**.
trans-unit.target: When using the [Azure Portal][preview-portal] to create a Linux-based HDInsight cluster, you must enter an **SSH Username**, and select to enter a **PASSWORD** or **SSH PUBLIC KEY**.

trans-unit.source: If you select **SSH PUBLIC KEY**, you can either paste the public key (displayed in the __Public key for pasting into OpenSSH authorized\_keys file__ field in PuttyGen,) into the __SSH PublicKey__ field, or select __Select a file__ to browse and select the file that contains the public key.
trans-unit.target: If you select **SSH PUBLIC KEY**, you can either paste the public key (displayed in the __Public key for pasting into OpenSSH authorized\_keys file__ field in PuttyGen,) into the __SSH PublicKey__ field, or select __Select a file__ to browse and select the file that contains the public key.

trans-unit.source: ![Image of form asking for public key](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/ssh-key.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Image of form asking for public key](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/ssh-key.png)

trans-unit.source: This creates a login for the specified user, and enables either password authentication or SSH key authentication.
trans-unit.target: This creates a login for the specified user, and enables either password authentication or SSH key authentication.

trans-unit.source: Azure Command-Line Interface for Mac, Linux, and Windows
trans-unit.target: Azure Command-Line Interface for Mac, Linux, and Windows

trans-unit.source: You can use the [Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows](../xplat-cli-install.md) to create a new cluster by using the `azure hdinsight cluster create` command.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows](../xplat-cli-install.md) to create a new cluster by using the `azure hdinsight cluster create` command.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using this command, see [Provision Hadoop Linux clusters in HDInsight using custom options](hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using this command, see [Provision Hadoop Linux clusters in HDInsight using custom options](hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters.md).

trans-unit.source: Connect to a Linux-based HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Connect to a Linux-based HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: Open PuTTY.
trans-unit.target: Open PuTTY.

trans-unit.source: ![putty interface](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/putty.png)
trans-unit.target: ![putty interface](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/putty.png)

trans-unit.source: If you provided an SSH key when you created your user account, you must perform the following step to select the private key to use when authenticating to the cluster:
trans-unit.target: If you provided an SSH key when you created your user account, you must perform the following step to select the private key to use when authenticating to the cluster:

trans-unit.source: In **Category**, expand **Connection**, expand **SSH**, and select **Auth**.
trans-unit.target: In **Category**, expand **Connection**, expand **SSH**, and select **Auth**.

trans-unit.source: Finally, click **Browse** and select the .ppk file that contains your private key.
trans-unit.target: Finally, click **Browse** and select the .ppk file that contains your private key.

trans-unit.source: ![putty interface, select private key](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/puttykey.png)
trans-unit.target: ![putty interface, select private key](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/puttykey.png)

trans-unit.source: In **Category**, select **Session**.
trans-unit.target: In **Category**, select **Session**.

trans-unit.source: From the **Basic options for your PuTTY session** screen, enter the SSH address of your HDInsight server in the **Host name (or IP address)** field.
trans-unit.target: From the **Basic options for your PuTTY session** screen, enter the SSH address of your HDInsight server in the **Host name (or IP address)** field.

trans-unit.source: The SSH address is your cluster name, then **-ssh.azurehdinsight.net**.
trans-unit.target: The SSH address is your cluster name, then **-ssh.azurehdinsight.net**.

trans-unit.source: For example, **mycluster-ssh.azurehdinsight.net**.
trans-unit.target: For example, **mycluster-ssh.azurehdinsight.net**.

trans-unit.source: ![putty interface with ssh address entered](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/puttyaddress.png)
trans-unit.target: ![putty interface with ssh address entered](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/puttyaddress.png)

trans-unit.source: To save the connection information for future use, enter a name for this connection under **Saved Sessions**, and then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: To save the connection information for future use, enter a name for this connection under **Saved Sessions**, and then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: The connection will be added to the list of saved sessions.
trans-unit.target: The connection will be added to the list of saved sessions.

trans-unit.source: Click **Open** to connect to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click **Open** to connect to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If this is the first time you have connected to the cluster, you will receive a security alert.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If this is the first time you have connected to the cluster, you will receive a security alert.

trans-unit.source: This is normal.
trans-unit.target: This is normal.

trans-unit.source: Select **Yes** to cache the server's RSA2 key to continue.
trans-unit.target: Select **Yes** to cache the server's RSA2 key to continue.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the user that you entered when you created the cluster.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the user that you entered when you created the cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you provided a password for the user, you will be prompted to enter it also.
trans-unit.target: If you provided a password for the user, you will be prompted to enter it also.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The above steps assume you are using port 22, which will connect to head node 0 on the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The above steps assume you are using port 22, which will connect to head node 0 on the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you use port 23, you will connect to head node 1.
trans-unit.target: If you use port 23, you will connect to head node 1.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the head nodes, see [Availability and reliability of Hadoop clusters in HDInsight](hdinsight-high-availability-linux.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on the head nodes, see [Availability and reliability of Hadoop clusters in HDInsight](hdinsight-high-availability-linux.md).

trans-unit.source: Connect to worker nodes
trans-unit.target: Connect to worker nodes

trans-unit.source: The worker nodes are not directly accessible from outside the Azure datacenter, but they can be accessed from the cluster head node via SSH.
trans-unit.target: The worker nodes are not directly accessible from outside the Azure datacenter, but they can be accessed from the cluster head node via SSH.

trans-unit.source: If you provided an SSH key when you created your user account, you must perform the following steps to use the private key when authenticating to the cluster if you want to connect to the worker nodes.
trans-unit.target: If you provided an SSH key when you created your user account, you must perform the following steps to use the private key when authenticating to the cluster if you want to connect to the worker nodes.

trans-unit.source: Install Pageant from [http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html).
trans-unit.target: Install Pageant from [http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html).

trans-unit.source: This utility is used to cache SSH keys for PuTTY.
trans-unit.target: This utility is used to cache SSH keys for PuTTY.

trans-unit.source: Run Pageant.
trans-unit.target: Run Pageant.

trans-unit.source: It will minimize to an icon in the status tray.
trans-unit.target: It will minimize to an icon in the status tray.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the icon and select **Add Key**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the icon and select **Add Key**.

trans-unit.source: ![adding key](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/addkey.png)
trans-unit.target: ![adding key](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/addkey.png)

trans-unit.source: When the browse dialog appears, select the .ppk file that contains the key, and then click **Open**.
trans-unit.target: When the browse dialog appears, select the .ppk file that contains the key, and then click **Open**.

trans-unit.source: This adds the key to Pageant, which will provide it to PuTTY when connecting to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This adds the key to Pageant, which will provide it to PuTTY when connecting to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you used an SSH key to secure your account, you must complete the previous steps before you will be able to connect to worker nodes.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you used an SSH key to secure your account, you must complete the previous steps before you will be able to connect to worker nodes.

trans-unit.source: Open PuTTY.
trans-unit.target: Open PuTTY.

trans-unit.source: If you use an SSH key to authenticate, in the **Category** section, expand **Connection**, expand **SSH**, and then select **Auth**.
trans-unit.target: If you use an SSH key to authenticate, in the **Category** section, expand **Connection**, expand **SSH**, and then select **Auth**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Authentication parameters** section, enable **Allow agent forwarding**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Authentication parameters** section, enable **Allow agent forwarding**.

trans-unit.source: This allows PuTTY to automatically pass the certificate authentication through the connection to the cluster head node when connecting to worker nodes.
trans-unit.target: This allows PuTTY to automatically pass the certificate authentication through the connection to the cluster head node when connecting to worker nodes.

trans-unit.source: ![allow agent forwarding](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/allowforwarding.png)
trans-unit.target: ![allow agent forwarding](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/allowforwarding.png)

trans-unit.source: Connect to the cluster as documented earlier.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the cluster as documented earlier.

trans-unit.source: If you use an SSH key for authentication, you do not need to select the key - the SSH key added to Pageant will be used to authenticate to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you use an SSH key for authentication, you do not need to select the key - the SSH key added to Pageant will be used to authenticate to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: After the connection has been established, use the following to retrieve a list of the nodes in your cluster.
trans-unit.target: After the connection has been established, use the following to retrieve a list of the nodes in your cluster.

trans-unit.source: Replace *ADMINPASSWORD* with the password for your cluster admin account.
trans-unit.target: Replace *ADMINPASSWORD* with the password for your cluster admin account.

trans-unit.source: Replace *CLUSTERNAME* with the name of your cluster.
trans-unit.target: Replace *CLUSTERNAME* with the name of your cluster.

trans-unit.source: This will return information in JSON format for the nodes in the cluster, including `host_name`, which contains the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) for each node.
trans-unit.target: This will return information in JSON format for the nodes in the cluster, including `host_name`, which contains the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) for each node.

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of a `host_name` entry returned by the **curl** command:
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of a `host_name` entry returned by the **curl** command:

trans-unit.source: Once you have a list of the worker nodes you want to connect to, use the following command from the PuTTY session to open a connection to a worker node:
trans-unit.target: Once you have a list of the worker nodes you want to connect to, use the following command from the PuTTY session to open a connection to a worker node:

trans-unit.source: Replace *USERNAME* with your SSH user name and *FQDN* with the FQDN for the worker node.
trans-unit.target: Replace *USERNAME* with your SSH user name and *FQDN* with the FQDN for the worker node.

trans-unit.source: For example, `workernode0.workernode-0-e2f35e63355b4f15a31c460b6d4e1230.j1.internal.cloudapp.net`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `workernode0.workernode-0-e2f35e63355b4f15a31c460b6d4e1230.j1.internal.cloudapp.net`.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you use a password to authentication your SSH session, you will be prompted to enter the password again.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you use a password to authentication your SSH session, you will be prompted to enter the password again.

trans-unit.source: If you use an SSH key, the connection should finish without any prompts.
trans-unit.target: If you use an SSH key, the connection should finish without any prompts.

trans-unit.source: Once the session has been established, the prompt for your PuTTY session will change from `username@hn0-clustername` to `username@wn0-clustername` to indicate that you are connected to the worker node.
trans-unit.target: Once the session has been established, the prompt for your PuTTY session will change from `username@hn0-clustername` to `username@wn0-clustername` to indicate that you are connected to the worker node.

trans-unit.source: Any commands you run at this point will run on the worker node.
trans-unit.target: Any commands you run at this point will run on the worker node.

trans-unit.source: Once you have finished performing actions on the worker node, use the `exit` command to close the session to the worker node.
trans-unit.target: Once you have finished performing actions on the worker node, use the `exit` command to close the session to the worker node.

trans-unit.source: This will return you to the `username@hn0-clustername` prompt.
trans-unit.target: This will return you to the `username@hn0-clustername` prompt.

trans-unit.source: Add more accounts
trans-unit.target: Add more accounts

trans-unit.source: If you need to add more accounts to your cluster, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: If you need to add more accounts to your cluster, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Generate a new public key and private key for the new user account as described previously.
trans-unit.target: Generate a new public key and private key for the new user account as described previously.

trans-unit.source: From an SSH session to the cluster, add the new user with the following command:
trans-unit.target: From an SSH session to the cluster, add the new user with the following command:

trans-unit.source: This will create a new user account, but will disable password authentication.
trans-unit.target: This will create a new user account, but will disable password authentication.

trans-unit.source: Create the directory and files to hold the key by using the following commands:
trans-unit.target: Create the directory and files to hold the key by using the following commands:

trans-unit.source: When the nano editor opens, copy and paste in the contents of the public key for the new user account.
trans-unit.target: When the nano editor opens, copy and paste in the contents of the public key for the new user account.

trans-unit.source: Finally, use **Ctrl-X** to save the file and exit the editor.
trans-unit.target: Finally, use **Ctrl-X** to save the file and exit the editor.

trans-unit.source: ![image of nano editor with example key](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/nano.png)
trans-unit.target: ![image of nano editor with example key](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows/nano.png)

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to change ownership of the .ssh folder and contents to the new user account:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to change ownership of the .ssh folder and contents to the new user account:

trans-unit.source: You should now be able to authenticate to the server with the new user account and private key.
trans-unit.target: You should now be able to authenticate to the server with the new user account and private key.

trans-unit.source: SSH tunneling
trans-unit.target: SSH tunneling

trans-unit.source: SSH can be used to tunnel local requests, such as web requests, to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: SSH can be used to tunnel local requests, such as web requests, to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The request will then be routed to the requested resource as if it had originated on the HDInsight cluster head node.
trans-unit.target: The request will then be routed to the requested resource as if it had originated on the HDInsight cluster head node.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] An SSH tunnel is a requirement for accessing the web UI for some Hadoop services.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] An SSH tunnel is a requirement for accessing the web UI for some Hadoop services.

trans-unit.source: For example, both the Job History UI or Resource Manager UI can only be accessed using an SSH tunnel.
trans-unit.target: For example, both the Job History UI or Resource Manager UI can only be accessed using an SSH tunnel.

trans-unit.source: For more information on creating and using an SSH tunnel, see [Use SSH Tunneling to access Ambari web UI, ResourceManager, JobHistory, NameNode, Oozie, and other web UI's](hdinsight-linux-ambari-ssh-tunnel.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on creating and using an SSH tunnel, see [Use SSH Tunneling to access Ambari web UI, ResourceManager, JobHistory, NameNode, Oozie, and other web UI's](hdinsight-linux-ambari-ssh-tunnel.md).

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you understand how to authenticate by using an SSH key, learn how to use MapReduce with Hadoop on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Now that you understand how to authenticate by using an SSH key, learn how to use MapReduce with Hadoop on HDInsight.

trans-unit.target: [Use Hive with HDInsight](hdinsight-use-hive.md)

trans-unit.target: [Use Pig with HDInsight](hdinsight-use-pig.md)

trans-unit.target: [Use MapReduce jobs with HDInsight](hdinsight-use-mapreduce.md)
